fields.title: sufficient statistics
fields.pointers:
*  [Exponential families](exponential_families)  are a class of distributions which can be parameterized in terms of sufficient statistics.
* The  [maximum likelihood estimator](maximum_likelihood)  depends only on sufficient statistics.
* Many sufficient statistics correspond to  [moments](expectation_and_variance)  of a distribution.
fields.summary: Sufficient statistics are statistics which summarize all of the information a dataset contains about the parameters of a distribution. The Rao-Blackwell Theorem implies that statistical estimators should depend only on sufficient statistics when they exist.
